title: Big Tech’s spending spree is about far more than capex
snippet: Big Tech companies have long been cash-generating behemoths. The latest capex splurge could push some of them into a cash-burn mode.

title: Instagram chief says he does not believe people can get clinically addicted to social media
snippet: Instagram chief says he does not believe people can get clinically addicted to social media

title: What is ByteDance’s Seedance 2.0? The cinematic AI video generator powered by text, image and audio inputs
snippet: As AI video tools continue to evolve, Seedance 2.0’s beta launch suggests a shift from simple text-generated clips toward more structured, controllable, and cinematic AI storytelling.

title: Who is Amanda Askell? The philosopher Anthropic trusts to teach Claude AI morals and ‘how to be good’
snippet: Amanda Askell as a key architect of “Constitutional AI,” works to ensure the chatbot is helpful, honest and harmless. Her role blends philosophy, AI safety and practical model training.

title: Google prepares Android 17 Beta as Android 16 QPR3 testing wraps up: What to expect
snippet: Google has begun rolling out Android 16 QPR3 Beta 2.1 to testers and confirmed Android 17 Beta 1 is arriving soon for enrolled Pixel devices. While details remain scarce, early reports hint at UI tweaks, including a redesigned notifications panel and separate Quick Settings gestures.

title: AI-generated reels? Instagram reportedly tests personal likeness feature: What to expect
snippet: Instagram is reportedly developing an AI powered “Create my likeness” tool that lets users generate photos and videos using their own face. The feature may also allow permission based use of others’ likenesses, positioning the platform as a potential rival to OpenAI’s Sora.

title: Google rolls out easier way to request removal of explicit images from Search: How it works
snippet: Google has launched new tools that allow users to request the removal of sensitive and non-consensual explicit content from Search. The update simplifies reporting, supports multiple submissions, offers proactive filtering and lets people track requests in one place. Here is how the tools work.

title: Battlefield 6 Season 2 drops new map, modes and major fixes: Launch date and all you need to know
snippet: Battlefield 6 Season 2 launches on 17 February with a new Contaminated map, limited-time narrative modes and major gameplay upgrades. EA is also improving progression, Battle Pass rewards, weapon balance and netcode across PC, PS5 and Xbox Series S/X.

title: AI rules: 2-hour deepfake takedown timeline lands Big Tech in compliance furore
snippet: On 10 February, Meity notified AI deepfake takedown and labelling rules. While the industry welcomed its labelling relaxation and image editing exemption, heavily compressed takedown windows may land social media firms in a 10-day rush to achieve compliance—or face potential litigation.

title: iPhone 18 Pro leak suggests same price, faster chip and larger battery: All you need to know
snippet: Apple may keep iPhone 18 Pro and iPhone 18 Pro Max prices unchanged despite rising component costs, analysts say. Supply chain savings, new memory deals and upgrades such as a 2nm A20 Pro chip, improved cameras and bigger batteries are expected ahead of a September launch.

title: AI Impact Summit 2026: How India plans to deploy, govern and procure AI
snippet: As India prepares to host the AI Impact Summit 2026 in New Delhi, the focus shifts to how India plans to build and govern AI systems for public services through the IndiaAI Mission

title: Elon Musk restructures xAI's teams following co-founders' departure
snippet: The exits follow xAI's recent merger with SpaceX, a move that valued the combined company at $1.25 trillion

title: Cyber conference: Experts urge telcos to tighten rules to curb cyber fraud
snippet:
Experts have recommended that telecom service providers take greater responsibility in strengthening customer verification processes and extending proactive support to investigative agencies to deal with cyber criminals, officials said on Wednesday.
The recommendations were made at the national conf

title: Former OpenAI researcher quits as firm explores advertising like Facebook
snippet: As Facebook chased engagement and ad revenue, promises of user control eroded, raising concerns that AI platforms may repeat the same pattern, with risks to privacy and mental health

title: Why retro emulation handhelds often make better gaming consoles on the go
snippet: From simpler software to better portability, retro handhelds fit the idea of mobile gaming better, while modern Windows-based devices trade comfort and cost for raw power and ecosystem features

title: YouTube Music introduces Spotify-like AI playlist feature for premium users
snippet: YouTube Music has rolled out a new AI Playlist feature for Premium users, allowing them to create personalised playlists by simply describing a mood, idea, or genre

title: Google to soon release Android 17 beta 1 for public testing: What to expect
snippet: Google has confirmed that Android 17 beta 1 is coming soon for public testing and will roll out automatically to users already enrolled in the Android Beta Program

title: Google Photos brings 'Create with AI' templates to iPhone, iPad: What's new
snippet: Google Photos is rolling out its "Create with AI" templates to iPhone and iPad users, bringing AI-powered photo editing tools to more countries beyond Android

title: India's enterprise AI boom is driving surge in data leakage risks: Report

title: Musk reorganises xAI after SpaceX merger and ahead of  IPO
snippet: Billionaire Elon Musk has overhauled the management of his artificial intelligence startup xAI ahead of a planned ​initial public offering that could rank among the largest ever, after merging the company with his rocket firm SpaceX.

title: OpenAI is making the mistakes Facebook made; AI researcher quits company
snippet: A departing OpenAI researcher argues ads on ChatGPT aren’t inherently wrong but risk exploiting intimate user data and incentivising manipulation. He urges alternatives to keep AI accessible without surveillance-driven advertising or restricting powerful tools to the wealthy.

title: These AI dreamers don't fit the stereotype
snippet: Marshall Kools, 24, shares a modest San Francisco apartment while chasing AI riches with his startup, Arzana. title: Data fears and tech resentment greet AI wearable's Europe launch

title: YouTube argues it isn't social media in landmark tech addiction trial
snippet: YouTube, its lawyers said, is an entertainment platform more like Netflix than a social network like Facebook. People use the video streaming app to learn how to cook, knit and become pop stars, not endlessly scroll, they added.

title: Pentagon pushing AI companies to expand on classified networks, sources say
snippet: The Pentagon is pushing the top AI companies including OpenAI and Anthropic to make their artificial-intelligence tools available ​on classified networks without many of the standard restrictions ​that the companies apply to users.

title: Instagram chief says social media is not 'clinically addictive' in landmark trial
snippet: Instagram's chief executive said Wednesday that social media was not "clinically addictive," refuting claims that the platform prioritised making money over the mental health of young users in a landmark tech addiction case.

title: Anthropic to shoulder some costs as data center expansions threaten to raise power bills
snippet: Anthropic on Wednesday announced initiatives to ​limit the impact of data ​centers on consumer energy prices amid increased investment ​in power-hungry infrastructure necessary for AI tech.

title: Flipkart eyes food delivery wars; Borrowing costs & fintechs

title: EVs could be cheaper to own than gas cars in Africa by 2040
snippet: Electric vehicles could be economically competitive in Africa sooner than expected.
